conclusion: Number of turns in the coil: m = 100, Coil's internal resistance: r = 10 Ω, External resistance: R = 90 Ω, From Figure Z, the magnetic flux Φ through each turn varies sinusoidally with time, At t = 0, the coil plane is parallel to the magnetic field
The flux varies sinusoidally with time, The period appears to be around 12.56 × 10⁻⁷ s (from 0 to ~12.56 × 10⁻⁷), The amplitude of the flux is 2 × 10⁻⁷ Wb per turn

premise: The flux varies sinusoidally with time, The amplitude of the flux is 2 × 10⁻⁷ Wb per turn
conclusion: The flux through each turn can be expressed as: Φ(t) = Φₘₐₓ sin(ωt) where Φₘₐₓ = 2 × 10⁻⁷ Wb

premise: The period appears to be around 12.56 × 10⁻⁷ s

conclusion: The EMF is given by Faraday's law: 𝓔 = -m dΦ/dt

premise: dΦ/dt = d/dt[Φₘₐₓ sin(ωt)] = Φₘₐₓ ω cos(ωt)
conclusion: For m = 100 turns: 𝓔 = -m Φₘₐₓ ω cos(ωt) = -100 × 2 × 10⁻⁷ × 5 × 10⁶ cos(ωt)
